alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Hampshire (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 21 at 6:04PM EDT until July 21 at 8:15PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: The National Weather Service in Norton has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Franklin County in western Massachusetts... North Central Hampshire County in western Massachusetts... * Until 815 PM EDT. * At 604 PM EDT, Doppler radar showed re-developing thunderstorms across northwest Franklin County and into Berkshire County in Massachusetts that will produce another period of heavy to excessive rain across the warned area. Between 3.5 and 6 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 1 to 1.5 inches in 1 hour. Flash flooding has occurred earlier and is ongoing, and worsened or new areas of flooding are expected. Significant, considerable flooding impacts are expected to resume. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Emergency management and town fire and police departments in Conway, Greenfield and Deerfield had seen multiple road washouts and road damage, along with flooding of residential basements and businesses in those towns. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of urbanized areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Areas that experienced flooding this afternoon are likely to experience worsened flooding from additional heavy rain. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Greenfield, Deerfield, Montague, Williamsburg, Bernardston, Buckland, Conway, Shelburne, Ashfield, Gill, Whately, Chesterfield, Goshen, Cummington and Leyden. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-1.5 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
